text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today 
I'm going to show you how type people do pasta

now growing up in Thailand I only ever had two 
types of pasta it's either spaghetti with sort

of a Thai style meat sauce or it's what we're 
making today which is coming called Pad macaroni

now Pad means to stir-fry and macaroni is exactly 
what it sounds like so when I was little I always

thought that this dish was western food and then I 
discovered later that it's unique to Thailand and

it's more of our interpretation of what western 
food is so I'm going to show you this dish it's

super delicious and if you have kids they're 
going to love it because it is a very popular

kids dish in Thailand so let's get started so the 
ingredient list is going to look a little bit not

Thai because that's sort of the whole point of 
it so the main sauce for this is actually ketchup

so ketchup in Thailand is sort of the epitome 
of Western ingredients it's what we associate

with western food so if you see someone putting 
ketchup in Pad Thai that is wrong and wrong it is

essentially a westernized Pad Thai by definition 
and then of course because it's still for Thai

people we're going to add some sriracha hot sauce 
so this is a Thai sriracha the bottle looks like

this however you can just use regular rooster 
brand sriracha and how much you add depends on

how spicy you want it to be this is just going 
to be a little bit spicy but you're making this

for kids you want no spicy at all you can just 
do all ketchup or you can do more sriracha than

ketchup it's completely up to you oh and I have 
a recipe if you want to make your own sriracha

as well I'm going to add some golden mountains 
sauce so golden mountain goes really well with

ketchup and by the way in case you don't know what 
golden mountain sauce is it is basically a type of

soy sauce that we use often in Thai cuisine and 
it's got a richer flavour than our standard soy

sauce Maggi is a similar flavored sauce that 
you can also use or you can just use regular

soy sauce as well I'm going to add just a touch of 
sugar because I find that if I don't the vinegar

in the sriracha and the ketchup is a little bit 
sharp but if you think that your ketchup is very

sweet you can always wait to add the sugar at the 
end so you can taste it first before you see if

it needs any touch of white pepper for a little 
kick I always love white pepper and that's it

that's the sauce pasta choice so in Thailand we 
obviously use macaroni for pot macaroni but when

we say macaroni in Thailand it's one of two things 
it's either an elbow macaroni but it's bigger much

bigger than the ones you can find in North America 
or it's a long macaroni which is basically like

a spaghetti with a big hole running through the 
middle so I can't find those here so I would say

use any tube pasta you can find as long as it's 
got hole running through the middle you can be

fine so I love these screwy ones I think they're 
really fun to eat that is it we are ready to cook

a little tip timing wise I like to drop my pasta 
just before I'm ready to get started in the wok

because I know I'm not going to take any longer 
than it takes a pasta to cook and you don't want

to let the pasta sit you know for a long time 
because then it gets cold and clumpy and all

that stuff so this works out for me every time 
all right so I am going to do what I normally do

which is cook my protein separately so for this 
dish I've got some shrimp which is common for

pot macaroni but you can also do chicken if you 
want to make this vegetarian you can do tofu if

you're going to do a chicken though make sure you 
marinate it a little bit in some soy sauce so that

it's got some flavor and that's it I've got some 
nice browning on the shrimp I know my shrimp are

perfectly cooked and then I don't have to worry 
about them overcooking in the wok later I'm going

to add just a little bit more oil and then a 
butter so there's actually an idea I got from

one of my Instagram fans and she said that her 
mom puts butter and I thought that's a brilliant

idea so keep the heat a little low at this point 
because the pan and hot from earlier and then some

garlic going in let the garlic toast in the butter 
and then as the butter starts to brown go in with

some carrots and onions so if you notice even 
the choice of vegetables for this is very not

choice Oh carrots is not something that we use 
a lot even onion shallots is sort of the more

traditional onion so a lot of times will refer 
to the big onion as western onion and how long

you cook the carrots on the onion just depends 
on if you like them soft or crunchy if you like

them crunchy just one minute and move on and then 
I'm going to add some eggs lots of eggs for this

I like to add three I think egg is sort of what 
makes this dish really yummy they hold on to the

sauce really well break the yolks don't scramble 
it just yet let it set partway because you don't

want it to be just complete mush you want nice big 
pieces in there and then you get this nice marbled

effect with the white and the yolk so once it's 
sort of almost set then they can toss it with the

vegetables all right now I'm going to turn this 
off because the next thing to go in is the pasta

and I am just about two minutes away so let's it 
just turn it off and leave it nothing bad is gonna

happen you can just relax and clean up a little 
bit okay so my pasta just finished just gonna

drain it but the only thing I would say if you're 
using a short tube pasta like this is make sure

you really really shake the colander because a lot 
of times there's water less hanging out inside and

that water salty right because you're gonna salt 
your pasta water right yes you're gonna salt your

pasta water and sometimes there's just salty water 
clocked in there and you don't want it to make go

in and make your pasta too salty so really give 
it a nice shake we okay that's done I'm going to

turn this back on all right the pasta is going in 
boom boss is going in boom oh yeah give it a quick

toss so now once it's all nice and thoroughly 
coated you can go ahead and taste it and if

you if it needs more sugar or anything now's 
the time to adjust I'm going to go in now with

some tomatoes and tomatoes are also not entirely 
Thai because tomatoes in Thai is called Macoutes

hit which if you literally translate it it means 
for an eggplant okay so finally I'm gonna just

turn this off toss in some green onions for some 
freshness and almost forgot our shrimp going back

in yeah that's good and just give it a quick toss 
and the juices from the tomatoes are going to come

out and sort of mix with the sauce a little bit 
whoo that looks great so I don't recommend saving

this for later because you see how it's all nice 
and shiny and luscious I find that if I you know

make it in advance and reheat it later it's still 
good but it's not going to be as moist because all

that sauce that's shiny on the outside is going 
to get absorbed into the pasta so if you can eat

this fresh right off the wok like I'm going to do 
right now mmm oh the flavors of childhood except

when we made it when I was little we didn't add 
any sriracha because yeah we were kids but now

it's a little spicy sweet tart it sort of got 
the same feel as like a sweet and sour stir-fry

type thing so if you like sweet and sour stir-fry 
you're gonna love this and kids will go nuts for

this heck adults go nuts for this stuff so I hope 
you give it a try so easy and it's a weeknight

pasta dish and when you make it send me a photo 
on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and the recipe as

always will be a hottie kitchen calm and I will 
see you next time for your name finishes time
